title: bold serif average
content:
why does this one pose a problem? Because it looks like 1,000 different fonts and my brain is not built right for this.

I thought it was just Times New Roman Bold but the N isnt quite right, any help is appreciated.

Thanks

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121131507im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/lynden_4282.jpg)

 [‹ Intersport Logo - 'SPORT' Font used?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121131507/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41737 "Go to previous forum topic") [Blossa Glögg fonts ID ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121131507/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41735 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jrgott

comments.content: Hmmm... looks an awful lot like Times New Roman Bold Condensed from Monotype, though the chars may be a little more condensed. I’d think it’s definitely SOMEBODY’S Times Roman...

Yeah. I agree. Definitely Times New roman.  
FLOOR DESIGN might be Bold Condensed and squooshed a bit.
Thanks guys, I’ll go with it.
